00028    enum RulerFormat {
00029       IntFormat,
00030       RealFormat,
00031       RealLogFormat,
00032       TimeFormat,
00033       LinearDBFormat,
00034    };
00035 
00036    //
00037    // Constructor / Destructor
00038    //
00039 
00040    Ruler();
00041    ~Ruler();

00044    // Required Ruler Parameters
00045    //
00046 
00047    void SetBounds(int left, int top, int right, int bottom);
00048 
00049    // wxHORIZONTAL || wxVERTICAL
00050    void SetOrientation(int orient);
00051 
00052    // min is the value at (x, y)
00053    // max is the value at (x+width, y+height)
00054    // (at the center of the pixel, in both cases)
00055    void SetRange(double min, double max);
00056 
00057    //
00058    // Optional Ruler Parameters
00059    //
00060 
00061    // IntFormat, RealFormat, or TimeFormat
00062    void SetFormat(RulerFormat format);
00063 
00064    // Specify the name of the units (like "dB") if you
00065    // want numbers like "1.6" formatted as "1.6 dB".
00066    void SetUnits(wxString units);
00067 
00068    // Logarithmic
00069    void SetLog(bool log);
00070 
00071    // Minimum number of pixels between labels
00072    void SetSpacing(int spacing);
00073 
00074    // If this is true, the edges of the ruler will always
00075    // receive a label.  If not, the nearest round number is
00076    // labeled (which may or may not be the edge).
00077    void SetLabelEdges(bool labelEdges);
00078 
00079    // Makes a vertical ruler hug the left side (instead of right)
00080    // and a horizontal ruler hug the top (instead of bottom)
00081    void SetFlip(bool flip);
00082 
00083    // Good defaults are provided, but you can override here
00084 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_RULER_AUTOSIZE
00085    void SetFonts(const wxFont &minorFont, const wxFont &majorFont, const wxFont &minorMinorFont);
00086 #else 
00087    void SetFonts(const wxFont &minorFont, const wxFont &majorFont);
00088 #endif //EXPERIMENTAL_RULER_AUTOSIZE
00089 
00090    // The ruler will not draw text within this (pixel) range.
00091    // Use this if you have another graphic object obscuring part
00092    // of the ruler's area.  The values start and end are interpreted
00093    // relative to the Ruler's local coordinates.
00094    void OfflimitsPixels(int start, int end);
00095 
00096    //
00097    // Calculates and returns the maximum size required by the ruler
00098    //
00099    void GetMaxSize(wxCoord *width, wxCoord *height);
00100 
00101    //
00102    // Drawing
00103    //
00104 
00105    // Note that it will not erase for you...
00106    void Draw(wxDC& dc);
00107    void Draw(wxDC& dc, Envelope *speedEnv, long minSpeed, long maxSpeed);
00108 
00109    // So we can have white ticks on black...
00110    void SetTickColour( const wxColour & colour)
00111    { mTickColour = colour; mPen.SetColour( colour );}
00112

00221 // This is an Audacity Specific ruler panel which additionally
00222 // has border, selection markers, play marker.
00223 // Once TrackPanel uses wxSizers, we will derive it from some 
00224 // wxWindow and the GetSize and SetSize functions
00225 // will then be wxWindows functions instead.
00226 class AUDACITY_DLL_API AdornedRulerPanel : public wxPanel
00227 {
00228 public:
00229    AdornedRulerPanel(wxWindow* parent,
00230                      wxWindowID id,
00231                      const wxPoint& pos = wxDefaultPosition,
00232                      const wxSize& size = wxDefaultSize,
00233                      ViewInfo *viewinfo = NULL);
00234 
00235    ~AdornedRulerPanel();
00236 
00237 public:
00238    static int GetRulerHeight() { return 28; }
00239    void SetLeftOffset(int offset){ mLeftOffset = offset; }
00240 
00241    void DrawCursor(double pos);
00242    void DrawIndicator(double pos, bool rec);

00249    
00250    void SetProject(AudacityProject* project) {mProject = project;};
